titles.title: Experimental data showing the effect of DC extracellular electric fields on neuronal membrane polarization in rat hippocampal slices using fast voltage-sensitive dye imaging technique

basic.description: Abstract / Acknowledgment --- In brains, elecrtic field with substantial gradient is generated by ativities of the brain cells, and it is conceivable that the electic fields modulate neuronal activities. To investigate the effect of DC extracellular electric fields on neuronal membrane polarization, we stained rat hippocampal brain slice preparations with fast voltage-sensitive dye and optically recorded the induced change in membrane potentials. We found that while the somatic regions show mono-phasic polarization with slow timeconstant, a biphasic polarization was observed in the apical dendritic regions. We reported the study in the following paper: M.Bikson, M.Inoue, H. Akiyama, J.K. Deans, J.E. Fox, H.Miyakawa, J.G.R. Jefferys J. Physiol., 557,175-190 (2004) PMID: 14978199 Effects of uniform extracellular DC electric fields on excitability in rat hippocampal slices in vitro. Here we provide raw experimenatal data we recorded in the study. The data were those used to prepare Figure 10 of the paper.
